repnme.cdata!:
Kenya - Institutional Reform and Capacity
            Building Technical Assistance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Institutional Reform and
            Capacity Building Technical Assistance Project for Kenya
            were as follows: outcomes were moderately satisfactory; risk
            to development outcome was substantial; Bank performance was
            moderately unsatisfactory and borrower performance was also
            moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned includes:
            political environment and public sector reform approach:
            public sector reforms are inherently political and their
            design and implementation has to be informed by a careful
            and ongoing political economy (PE) analysis. Fiscal roles of
            the branches of government and among different levels of
            government are clearly defined in law and practice. Public
            sector and governance reforms affect various interests and
            often face resistance. The design, however, may have
            underestimated the implementation challenges inherent in
            managing such a complex program. While the project design
            adequately identified high level leadership is key to
            successful project implementation, effective leadership at
            component and sub-component levels, is also equally important.

Kenya - Institutional Reform and Capacity
            Building Technical Assistance Project

16252839.trustfund:
TF056158-PHRD-KENYA: INSTITUTIONAL
            REFORM AND CAPACITY BUILDING PROJECT,TF057287-INSTITUTIONAL REFORM &
            CAPACITY BUILDING,TF093264-SUPERVISION SUPPORT FOR EU
            TRUST FUND FOR KENYA IRCBP

repnme.cdata!:
Kenya - Institutional Reform and Capacity
            Building Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the
            Institutional Reform and Capacity Building Project (IRCBP)
            is to strengthen Public Financial Management (PFM) systems
            to enhance transparency, accountability, and responsiveness
            to public expenditure policy priorities as well as enhance
            public service delivery through the effective implementation
            of Results Based Management (RBM). This restructuring of
            IRCBP is consistent with the Bank's commitment to
            continue to assist the Government's development of a
            new comprehensive strategy to reform public financial
            management in line with the requirements of the new
            constitution, and recognize that this effort is likely to
            include legislative and institutional changes, fiscal decentralization.

docna.cdata!:
Kenya - Institutional Reform and Capacity
            Building Project : restructuring

repnme.cdata!:
Kenya - Institutional Reform and Capacity
            Building Technical Assistance Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the
            Institutional Reform and Capacity Building Technical
            Assistance Project for Kenya is to strengthen public
            financial management (PFM) systems to enhance transparency,
            accountability, and responsiveness to public expenditure
            policy priorities as well as enhance public service delivery
            through the effective implementation of Results Based
            Management (RBM). The extension will give the Borrower more
            time to complete the implementation of on-going activities
            that are critical to the achievement of the project's
            development objectives (DOs) through a project
            restructuring. The Borrower has prepared a specific action
            plan acceptable to the International Development Association
            (IDA) to complete the project. The main thrust of the
            restructuring proposal would be to align the project with
            the requirements of the new constitution (promulgated August
            27, 2010) on public financial management and devolution, and
            change some aspects of the project design and implementation
            arrangement to reflect lessons learnt from over four years
            of project implementation. It will also align the project
            with the timing of the existing public financial management
            reform strategy.

            Capacity Building Technical Assistance Project :
            restructuring : Main report

repnme.cdata!:
Kenya - Institutional Reform and Capacity
            Building Technical Assistance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Institutional Reform and Capacity
            Building Technical Assistance Project for Kenya aims to
            strengthen public financial management systems to enhance
            their transparency, accountability, and responsiveness to
            public expenditure policy priorities as well as to enhance
            public service delivery. Public financial management systems
            will be strengthened through the effective implementation of
            Results Based Management. There are three project
            components, the first of which comprises several
            sub-components. Component 1, Budget and Public Financial
            Management, strengthens budget formulation; budget
            execution, accounting, and financial reporting; public
            financial management through the use of information
            technology; the external and internal audit systems; the
            national procurement system, and revenue and collection and
            management for the Kenya Revenue Authority; and provides
            support to key Parliamentary Committees for effective
            oversight of public financial management. Component 2,
            Capacity Building for "Results for Kenyans,"
            provides capacity support to five key ministries--Finance,
            Agriculture, Planning and Development, Trade and Industry,
            and Local Government; and focuses on enhancing the change
            management capacity of leaders in the Public Service and
            their teams in delivering 'Results for Kenyans'.
            It will also enhance the development and promotion of a
            value system and code of ethics developed from the existing
            legislation as well as best global practice as a tool to
            rejuvenate the service orientation and accountability for
            public servants. It will build on a pilot program underway
            on changing the ethos and practices of the leaders to be
            more effective in transforming the public service in support
            of the Economic Recovery Strategy, especially in leading
            teams to accept and implement Results Based Management as
            the main vehicle for driving reforms (Transformative
            Leadership and Ethics for Results Based Management).
            Component 3 will finance technical support and capacity for
            project implementation.
